translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: سوگند به ابتدای روز [وقتی که خورشید پرتو افشانی می کند]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: سوگند به آغاز روز،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: قسم به روز روشن

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: سوگند به روشنايى روز،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: قسم به روز روشن (یا هنگام ظهر آن).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: سوگند به روز (در آن زمان که آفتاب بلند می‌گردد و همه جا را فرا می‌گیرد)! [[«الضُّحَیا»: روز (نگا: اعراف / 98، طه / 59). چاشتگاه (نگا: شمس / 1).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: سوگند به روز روشن‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: قسم به روز در آن هنگام که آفتاب برآید (و همه جا را فراگیرد)،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: سوگند به چاشتگاه (یا روز)

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: سوگند به روشنايى و برآمدن روز.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: سوگند به روشنایی میان روز؛

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: I CALL TO witness the early hours of morning,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: By oath of the late morning,

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: By the white forenoon

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: By the morning brightness,

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: By the forenoon (after sun-rise);

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: By the morning light.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: By the bright forenoon,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: By the forenoon.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: By the morning hours

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: By the morning brightness,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: By the midmorning,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: By the morning brightness

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: By the midday brightness

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: I swear by the early hours of the day,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waaldduha

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: By the glorious morning light;

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: By the Glorious Morning Light,

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و سوگند به شب آن گاه که آرام گیرد،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و سوگند به شب چون آرام و در خود شود،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و به شب، آن دم كه آرام گيرد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: سوگند به شب چون آرام گيرد،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و قسم به شب به هنگام آرامش آن.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و سوگند به شب در آن هنگام که می‌آرامد (و تاریک می‌شود و همه‌جا را فرا می‌گیرد)! [[«سَجَی»: آرمید. آرام یافت. آرمیدن شب، در حقیقت آرمیدن ساکنان آن است (نگا: المصحف المیسّر). تاریک گردید. پوشاند. فرا گرفت (نگا: فرهنگ لغات قرآن. نمونه. تفهیم القرآن).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و سوگند به شب چون بیارمد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و سوگند به شب در آن هنگام که آرام گیرد،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و به شب گاهی که تیرگی افکند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و سوگند به شب چون در آيد و آرام گيرد- تاريكى آن همه را فرو پوشد-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و سوگند به شب چون به نیمه رسید؛

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And the night when dark and still,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And by oath of the night when it covers,

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and the brooding night!

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: By the night when it darkeneth,

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And by the night when it is still (or darkens);

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And the night as it settles.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and by the night when it covers the world with peace:

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: By the night when it darkens.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And by the night when it is stillest,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and by the night when it is calm!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and by the night when it covers,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And [by] the night when it covers with darkness,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and by the calm of night,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And the night when it covers with darkness.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waallayli itha saja

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and by the night when it darkens,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And by the Night when it is still,-

verses.text: مَا وَدَّعَکَ‌ رَبُّکَ‌ وَ مَا قَلَى‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: که پروردگارت تو را رها نکرده و مورد خشم و کینه قرار نداده است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: كه پروردگارت تو را ترك نكرده و بر تو خشم نگرفته است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: كه پروردگارت نه تو را واگذاشته و نه دشمن داشته

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [كه‌] پروردگارت تو را وانگذاشته، و دشمن نداشته است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: که خدای تو هیچ گاه تو را ترک نگفته و بر تو خشم ننموده است (چهل روز بر رسول وحی نیامد، دشمنان به طعنه گفتند: خدا از محمد قهر کرده. این آیه رد بر آنهاست).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: پروردگارت تو را رها نکرده است و دشمن نداشته است و مورد خشم قرار نداده است. [[«مَا وَدَّعَکَ»: تو را ترک و رها نکرده است. به ترک تو نگفته است. «مَا قَلَی»: خشم نگرفته است و دشمن نداشته است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: که پروردگارت با تو بدرود نکرده و بی‌مهر نشده است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: که خداوند هرگز تو را وانگذاشته و مورد خشم قرار نداده است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بدرودت نگفت پروردگارت و نه خشمگین شد

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: كه پروردگارت نه تو را فروگذاشته و نه دشمن داشته است.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (که) پروردگارت تو را وانگذاشته و دشمن نداشته است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Your Lord has neither left you, nor despises you.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Your Lord has not forsaken you nor does He dislike you!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Thy Lord has neither forsaken thee nor hates thee

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Thy Lord hath not forsaken thee, nor is He displeased.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Your Lord (O Muhammad (Peace be upon him)) has neither forsaken you nor hated you.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Your Lord did not abandon you, nor did He forget.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: (O Prophet), your Lord has neither forsaken you, nor is He displeased.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Your Lord has neither forsaken you nor hates you.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Thy Lord hath not forsaken thee nor doth He hate thee,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Your Lord has neither forsaken you, nor is He displeased with you,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: your Lord has not forsaken you (Prophet Muhammad), nor does He hate you.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Your Lord has not taken leave of you, [O Muhammad], nor has He detested [you].

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), your Lord has not abandoned you (by not sending you His revelation), nor is He displeased with you.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Your Lord has not forsaken you, nor has He become displeased,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: M<u>a</u> waddaAAaka rabbuka wam<u>a</u> qal<u>a</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: your Lord has not forsaken you, nor is He displeased with you,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Thy Guardian-Lord hath not forsaken thee, nor is He displeased.

verses.text: وَ لَلْآخِرَةُ خَيْرٌ لَکَ‌ مِنَ‌ الْأُولَى‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و بی تردید آخرت برای تو از دنیا بهتر است،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: هر آينه آخرت براى تو بهتر از دنياست.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و مسلما آخرت براى تو از دنيا بهتر است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و قطعاً آخرت براى تو از دنيا نيكوتر خواهد بود.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و البته عالم آخرت برای تو بسی بهتر از نشأه دنیاست.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و فرجام (کار و زندگی) برای تو، بهتر از آغاز (آنها) است. [[«الآخِرَةُ»: پایان کار. اواخر زندگی. «الأُولَی»: آغاز کار. اوائل زندگی.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و بی‌شک جهان واپسین برای تو بهتر از نخستین است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و مسلّماً آخرت برای تو از دنیا بهتر است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و همانا انجام بهتر است تو را از آغاز

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هر آينه آن جهان براى تو بهتر است از اين جهان.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و همانا (زندگی) آخرین برای تو از (زندگی) نخستین بهتر است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: What is to come is better for you than what has gone before;

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And indeed the latter is better for you than the former.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and the Last shall be better for thee than the First.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And the Hereafter is indeed better Unto thee than the life present.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And indeed the Hereafter is better for you than the present (life of this world).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: The Hereafter is better for you than the First.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Indeed what is to come will be better for you than what has gone by.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And indeed the Hereafter is better for you than the present.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And verily the latter portion will be better for thee than the former,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and the Hereafter shall be better for you than the world.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: The Last shall be better for you than the First.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And the Hereafter is better for you than the first [life].

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The reward in the next life will certainly be better for you than worldly gains.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And surely what comes after is better for you than that which has gone before.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Walal<u>a</u>khiratu khayrun laka mina alool<u>a</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and the Hereafter will indeed be better for you than the present life;

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And verily the Hereafter will be better for thee than the present.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و به زودی پروردگارت بخششی به تو خواهد کرد تا خشنود شوی.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: به زودى پروردگارت تو را عطا خواهد داد تا خشنود شوى.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و زود باشد كه پروردگارت [آنقدر] عطايت كند كه راضى شوى

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و بزودى پروردگارت تو را عطا خواهد داد، تا خرسند گردى.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و پروردگار تو به زودی به تو چندان عطا کند که تو راضی شوی (در دنیا نصرت و در آخرت مقام شفاعت به تو بخشد).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و پروردگارت به تو (بهروزی و پیروزی و نعمت و قدرت) عطاء خواهد کرد، و تو خوشنود خواهی شد. [[«لَسَوْفَ یُعْطِیکَ»: مراد نزول وحی، ظهور دین، تنفیذ فرمان، خوشبختی و پیروزی بر ملّتهای دیگر است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و پروردگارت به زودی به تو [مقام شفاعت‌] می‌بخشد و خشنود می‌شوی‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و بزودی پروردگارت آنقدر به تو عطا خواهد کرد که خشنود شوی!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و هر آینه زود است دهدت پروردگارت تا خشنود شوی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هر آينه پروردگارت تو را بخششى خواهد كرد كه خشنود شوى.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و در آینده‌ای دور، پروردگارت همواره تو را (رحمت بی‌زحمت رسالتی) اعطا خواهد کرد، پس خوشنود گردی.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: For your Lord will certainly give you, and you will be content.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And indeed your Lord will soon give you so much that you will be pleased. (Allah seeks to please the Holy Prophet – peace and blessings be upon him.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Thy Lord shall give thee, and thou shalt be satisfied.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And presently thy Lord shall give Unto thee so that thou shalt be be well-pleased.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And verily, your Lord will give you (all i.e. good) so that you shall be well-pleased.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And your Lord will give you, and you will be satisfied.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Verily your Lord will soon give you so amply that you will be well-pleased.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And verily, your Lord will give you so that you shall be well-pleased.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And verily thy Lord will give unto thee so that thou wilt be content.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Soon your Lord will give you [that with which] you will be pleased.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Your Lord will give you, and you will be satisfied.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And your Lord is going to give you, and you will be satisfied.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Your Lord will soon grant you sufficient favors to please you.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And soon will your Lord give you so that you shall be well pleased.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Walasawfa yuAA<u>t</u>eeka rabbuka fatar<u>da</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: soon you will be gratified with what your Lord will give you.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And soon will thy Guardian-Lord give thee (that wherewith) thou shalt be well-pleased.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا تو را یتیم نیافت، پس پناه داد؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا تو را يتيم نيافت و پناهت داد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: مگر نه يتيمت يافت و پناه داد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: مگر نه تو را يتيم يافت، پس پناه داد؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا خدا تو را یتیمی نیافت که در پناه خود جای داد؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا خدا تو را یتیم نیافت و پناهت داد؟ [[«یَتِیماً»: پیغمبر هنوز طفل شش ماهه‌ای در شکم مادر بود که پدرش از دنیا رفت. در عمر شش سالگی مادرش آمنه هم وفات کرد. در هشت سالگی پدر بزرگش عبدالمطّلب که سرپرستی او را به عهده داشت دار فانی را وداع گفت. از آن به بعد تحت سرپرستی عمویش ابوطالب قرار گرفت. «آوَی»: منزل و مأوی داد. پناه داد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آیا یتیمت نیافت که سر و سامانت داد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا او تو را یتیم نیافت و پناه داد؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا نیافتت یتیمی پس جای داد

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آيا تو را يتيمى نيافت پس جاى و پناه داد- به وسيله عمويت ابو طالب-؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: مگر نه (اینکه) تو را یتیم یافت، پس پناه داد؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Did He not find you an orphan and take care of you?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Did He not find you an orphan, so provided you shelter?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Did He not find thee an orphan, and shelter thee?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Found He not thee an orphan, so He sheltered thee?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Did He not find you (O Muhammad (Peace be upon him)) an orphan and gave you a refuge?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Did He not find you orphaned, and sheltered you?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Did He not find you an orphan and then gave you shelter?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Did He not find you an orphan and gave you a refuge

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Did He not find thee an orphan and protect (thee)?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Did He not find you an orphan, and shelter you?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Did He not find you an orphan and give you shelter?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Did He not find you an orphan and give [you] refuge?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Did He not find you as an orphan and give you shelter?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Did He not find you an orphan and give you shelter?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Alam yajidka yateeman fa<u>a</u>w<u>a</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Did He not find you orphaned and shelter you?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Did He not find thee an orphan and give thee shelter (and care)?

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و تو را بدون شریعت نیافت، پس به شریعت هدایت کرد؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا تو را گمگشته نيافت و هدايتت كرد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و سرگشته‌ات يافت پس راه نمود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و تو را سرگشته يافت، پس هدايت كرد؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و تو را (در بیابان مکه) ره گم کرده و حیران یافت (در طفولیت که حلیمه دایه‌ات آورد تا به جدّت عبد المطّلب سپارد در راه مکه گم شدی، حلیمه و عبد المطلب سخت پریشان شدند و خدا زود آنها را به تو) ره نمایی کرد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و تو را سرگشته و حیران (در میان شرکِ بت‌پرستان و یهودیان و مسیحیان، کفر کافران، فسق و فجور فاسقان و فاجران، ظلم و زور قلدران، کشت و کشتار قبائل به فرمان جاهلان، و خرافه‌پرستی اینان و آنان) نیافت و (در پرتوِ وحی آسمانی به یکتاپرستی یزدانی) رهنمودت کرد؟ [[«ضَآلاًّ»: گمراه و سرگشته. پیغمبر قبل از نبوّت، دریای موّاج کفر و شرک و ظلم و فسق و جهل و خرافات محیط را می‌دید و غرق‌شدگان در آن را نظاره می‌کرد، امّا راه به جائی نمی‌برد. نمی‌دانست چگونه خالق جهان را بپرستد و بدو نزدیک بشود، و از بارگاه یزدان نجات مردمان را بطلبد. به غار حراء پناه می‌برد و شبها و شبها با خود خلوت می‌کرد و سرگشته در تفکّرات و حیرت‌زده از مشاهده اوضاع به دنبال نجات می‌گشت، تا در دل غار حراء نور وحی پرتو افکند و او را به حق رهنمود کرد (نگا: شوری / 52، یوسف / 3).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و تو را سرگشته یافت و رهنمایی کرد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و تو را گمشده یافت و هدایت کرد،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و یافتت سر به گمی پس رهبری کرد

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و راه گم‌كرده‌ات يافت پس راه نمود.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و تو را سرگشته‌ای یافت، پس هدایت کرد؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Did He not find you perplexed, and show you the way?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And found you deeply engrossed in His love, so directed you?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Did He not find thee erring, and guide thee?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And He found thee wandering, so He guided thee,

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And He found you unaware (of the Quran, its legal laws, and Prophethood, etc.) and guided you?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And found you wandering, and guided you.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Did He not find you unaware of the Right Way, and then directed you to it?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And He found you unaware and guided you

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Did He not find thee wandering and direct (thee)?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Did He not find you astray, and guide you?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Did He not find you a wanderer so He guided you?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And He found you lost and guided [you],

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Did He not find you wandering about and give you guidance?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And find you lost (that is, unrecognized by men) and guide (them to you)?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wawajadaka <u>da</u>llan fahad<u>a</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Did He not find you wandering, and give you guidance?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And He found thee wandering, and He gave thee guidance.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و تو را تهیدست نیافت، پس بی نیاز ساخت؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا تو را درويش نيافت و توانگرت گردانيد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و محتاجت يافت و بى‌نياز كرد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و تو را تنگدست يافت و بى‌نياز گردانيد؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و باز تو را فقیر (الی الله) یافت (به دولت نبوت) توانگر کرد (و نعمت رسالت عطا نمود).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و تو را فقیر و بی‌چیز نیافت و ثروتمند و دارایت کرد؟ [[«عَآئِلاً»: فقیر و بی‌چیز (نگا: توبه / 28). چیزهائی که پیغمبر از پدر به ارث برد، شتر ماده‌ای و کنیزکی بود (نگا: جزء عمّ شیخ محمّد عبده). خدا او را با سود تجارت، و ثروت خدیجه، و غنائم جنگی دارا و بی‌نیاز کرد. آیات گذشته، بیانگر الطاف و عنایات خاصّ الهی در حق پیغمبر است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و تو را تهیدست یافت و بی‌نیازت کرد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و تو را فقیر یافت و بی‌نیاز نمود،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و یافتت گرانباری (عیالمند) پس بی‌نیاز کرد

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و نيازمندت يافت پس بى‌نياز و توانگر ساخت- به مال خديجه، يا به قناعت-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و تو را عیال‌وار یافت، پس بی‌نیاز گردانید؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Did He not find you poor and enrich you?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And found you in need, so made you prosperous?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Did He not find thee needy, and suffice thee?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And He found thee destitute, so He enriched thee.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And He found you poor, and made you rich (selfsufficient with selfcontentment, etc.)?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And found you in need, and enriched you?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And did He not find you in want, and then enriched you?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And He found you poor and made you rich

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Did He not find thee destitute and enrich (thee)?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Did He not find you needy, and enrich you?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Did He not find you poor and suffice you?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And He found you poor and made [you] self-sufficient.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: And did He not find you in need and make you rich?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And find you in want and make you to be free from want?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wawajadaka AA<u>a</u>ilan faaghn<u>a</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Did He not find you in want, and make you free from want?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And He found thee in need, and made thee independent.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و اما [به شکرانه این همه نعمت] یتیم را خوار و رانده مکن

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پس يتيم را ميازار،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس يتيم را خوار مدار و مران

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و اما [تو نيز به پاس نعمت ما] يتيم را ميازار،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس تو هم یتیم را هرگز میازار.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: حال که چنین است، یتیم را زبون مدار (و اموال و دارائی ایشان را با قهر و زور مگیر و تصرّف مکن). [[«لا تَقْهَرْ»: خوار و زبون مدار. اموال و دارائیشان را با زور مگیر و تصرّف مکن.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پس با یتیم تندی مکن‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: حال که چنین است یتیم را تحقیر مکن،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: اما یتیم را پس خشم نیار

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس، يتيم را خوار مدار و مران.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس اما یتیم را خوار و زار مکن.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So do not oppress the orphan,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Therefore do not oppress the orphan.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: As for the orphan, do not oppress him,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Wherefore as to the orphan, be thou not Unto him overbearing.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Therefore, treat not the orphan with oppression,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Therefore, do not mistreat the orphan.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Therefore, be not harsh with the orphan;

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Therefore, treat not the orphan with oppression.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Therefor the orphan oppress not,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So, as for the orphan, do not oppress him;

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Do not oppress the orphan,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So as for the orphan, do not oppress [him].

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Do not oppress the orphans

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Therefore, as for the orphan, do not oppress (him).

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faamm<u>a</u> alyateema fal<u>a</u> taqhar

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Therefore do not treat the orphan with harshness,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Therefore, treat not the orphan with harshness,

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و تهیدست حاجت خواه را [به بانگ زدن] از خود مران

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و گدا را مَران،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و با سائل خشونت مكن و مران

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و گدا را مران،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و فقیر و گدای سائل را به زجر مران.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و گدا را با خشونت مران. [[«لا تَنْهَرْ»: با خشونت مران. برخی سائل را خواهان دانش و پرسش کننده از مسائل علمی شمرده‌اند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و بر خواهنده بانگ مزن [و او را مران‌]

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و سؤال‌کننده را از خود مران،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و اما دریوزه را پس نران (یا نهیب نزن)

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و خواهنده- سائل نيازمند- را بانگ مزن و مران.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و اما سائل را پس (هرگز) بانگ مزن.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And do not drive the beggar away,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And do not rebuke the beggar.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and as for the beggar, scold him not;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And as to the beggar, chide thou him not.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And repulse not the beggar;

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Nor rebuff the seeker.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and chide not him who asks,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And repulse not the one who asks.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Therefor the beggar drive not away,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and as for the beggar, do not chide him;

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: nor drive away the one who asks.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And as for the petitioner, do not repel [him].

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and do not reject the beggars

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And as for him who asks, do not chide (him),

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waamma alssaila fala tanhar

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and do not chide the one who asks for help;

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Nor repulse the petitioner (unheard);

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و نعمت های پروردگارت را بازگو کن.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و از نعمت پروردگارت سخن بگوى.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و از موهبت پروردگارت [رسالت و معارف‌] سخن گوى

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و از نعمت پروردگار خويش [با مردم‌] سخن گوى.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و اما نعمت پروردگارت را (که مقام نبوت و تقرب کامل به خدا یافتی، بر امت) باز گو.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بلکه نعمتهای پروردگارت را بازگو کن (و از آنها صحبت بدار، و شکر آنها را با بذل و بخشش بگزار). [[«حَدِّثْ»: صحبت بدار. بازگو کن. بازگو کردن نعمت، شکرگزاری از آن با قول و فعل، امکان‌پذیر است. سپاس با زبان، و بذل و بخشش از آن. ذکر ثروت و قدرت برای تفاخر، مراد نیست.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و اما درباره نعمت پروردگارت [با سپاس‌] سخن بگوی‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و نعمتهای پروردگارت را بازگو کن!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و اما به نعمت پروردگار خویش پس زبان گشای‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و به نعمت پروردگارت- نبوّت و قرآن و هدايت و ...- سخن گوى- كه شكر آن است-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و اما به وسیله‌ی نعمت پروردگارت، پس (آن را) بازگو کن.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And keep recounting the favours of your Lord.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And abundantly proclaim the favours of your Lord.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and as for thy Lord's blessing, declare it.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And as to the favour of thine Lord discourse thou thereof.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And proclaim the Grace of your Lord (i.e. the Prophethood and all other Graces).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: But proclaim the blessings of your Lord.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and proclaim the bounty of your Lord.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And proclaim the grace of your Lord.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Therefor of the bounty of thy Lord be thy discourse.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and as for your Lord’s blessing, proclaim it!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: But tell of the favors of your Lord!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: But as for the favor of your Lord, report [it].

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and proclaim the bounties of your Lord.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And as for the favor of your Lord, do announce (it).

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waamm<u>a</u> biniAAmati rabbika fa<u>h</u>addith

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: but proclaim the blessings of your Lord.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But the bounty of the Lord - rehearse and proclaim!
